awd_titl_txt: Local Structure and Dynamics of Inorganic Network Glasses
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal plans to study the structure of borate glasses, and               the low temperature spin dynamics of the boron and oxygen sites,                through the use of a number of techniques including dynamic angle               spinning (DAS), magic angle spinning (MAS), 2D exchange NMR, and                low-field nuclear quadruple resonance.  The proposed program plans              also to determine the chemical and configurational orderings in a               range of IV-V-VI non-oxide chalcogenide glasses and study the                   effect of network connectivity on the nuclear spin relaxation.                  %%%%                                                                            This research will provide information which can aim greatly our                understanding of glass structures.  The use of dynamic technique                provides the prospect of a detailed characterization of  the                    disorder in glasses containing quadrupolar nuclei.  This may be                 especially important when quadrupolar nuclei are the network                    forming cations.  The dynamic information may be more important in              providing link between general glass theory and the physical                    meaning of the theoretical concepts.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
